visualStreaming.fullDesc:
A React Native full-stack project: implementing real-time face-swapping effects in live streaming applications. The core challenge is verifying feasibility using traditional geometric image processing (without training deep learning models), while ensuring cross-platform compatibility.

Technical Highlights:
â€¢ React Native + Vision Camera real-time preview with a custom Frame Processor design
â€¢ Native layer integration of ML Kit Face Detection, solving coordinate discrepancies between sensor frames and camera preview
â€¢ Kotlin â†” C++ (OpenCV) direct communication with 80%+ C++ code reuse on iOS

Independently completed Android/iOS dual-platform Demo in 4 months, covering full-stack integration across frontend, native, and algorithm layers.

motivation.title: Why Build This Project?
motivation.description: To verify whether real-time face swapping on mobile devices is feasible.
keyQuestions: Can real-time image processing run on mobile phones?
How can frontend (RN) and backend (native) collaborate efficiently?
What's the cost of cross-platform code reuse with C++?

challenges.title: Coordinate Transform & Device Adaptation
challenges.symptom: Face landmarks do not align with the preview
challenges.rootCause: The coordinate system of Vision Camera preview and the frame data are different
challenges.impact: Face swap effect appears at the wrong position

challenges.title: Compute Performance Bottleneck
challenges.rootCause: ML Kit face detection is expensive; running it on the main thread blocks rendering
challenges.impact: Stuttering UX and poor interaction responsiveness

challenges.title: Cross-platform Development Cost
challenges.rootCause: Separate Android/iOS implementations double the workload

solutions.approach: Custom rendering logic for coordinate mapping
details: Capture Vision Camera's frame.orientation to get current device orientation
Use Matrix.postRotate() to apply rotation compensation
Apply corresponding matrix transforms based on camera position (front/back): flip or no flip
Apply the final transform matrix when drawing on Canvas
solutions.result: Face landmarks perfectly align with the preview; supports multiple device orientations

details: Run FaceDetector on a background thread using Kotlin Coroutines with Dispatchers.IO
Cache face detection results in a member variable
Render layer reads cached results to avoid redundant computation
Draw directly with SurfaceView to reduce View hierarchy overhead
solutions.result: Main thread focuses on Canvas drawing while compute-intensive work runs in the background

details: Canvas performance is insufficient for complex deformation
C++ can be reused on both iOS and Android, lowering development cost
solutions.result: 80%+ C++ code reuse; development cycle reduced by 50%

10xAppSpeed.title: 10x App Speed
10xAppSpeed.shortDesc: Spearheaded deep architectural refactoring, slashing loading times by 90% and establishing global state management standards.
10xAppSpeed.fullDesc: Led the end-to-end optimization (Diagnosis â†’ Assessment â†’ Refactoring) for an application suffering from severe login bottlenecks (10s+ latency). Leveraged Flipper and React DevTools to pinpoint root causes: excessive global re-renders and redundant API state resets. After assessing maintenance costs and risks, I upgraded Redux Toolkit and implemented createSelector memoization, ultimately reducing login time by 90% and significantly smoothing multi-page navigation.
